For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Biochemistry</title>   <subtitle>Recognised internationally for our world-class research portfolio and excellence in teaching, Nottingham's School of Life Sciences contains one of the leading biochemistry divisions in the UK. We provide excellent teaching informed by cutting-edge research and our modular system allows a choice of subject areas and themes within a biochemistry degree.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/biochemistry.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" />   <generator>Contensis: http://www.contentmanagement.co.uk</generator>   <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/biochemistry.aspx?SyndicationType=2</id>   <updated>2015-03-12T01:37:29Z</updated>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/biochemistry.aspx?SyndicationType=2" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml" />   <entry>     <title>Biochemistry BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Chris Walters</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern biochemistry covers a wide area including molecular cell biology, molecular genetics, biotechnology, metabolism, and nutrition, and underpins all current advances in the biomedical sciences.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:03:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T16:04:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Biochemistry and Biological Chemistry BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry-biological-chemistry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Chris Walters</name>     </author>     <summary>The course will provide you with modern training in experimental techniques and give you wide-ranging skills in both biochemistry and biological chemistry. The BSc and MSci courses have the first two years in common and you can change from one to the other at any time within the first 16 months of the course.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:03:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T16:07:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry-biological-chemistry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Biochemistry and Biological Chemistry MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/msci-biochemistry-biological-chemistry.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Chris Walters</name>     </author>     <summary>This course provides you with  modern training in experimental techniques and gives you wide-ranging skills in both biochemistry and biological chemistry. The four-year MSci course is for students wishing to pursue scientific careers at the highest level or continue onto postgraduate research.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:03:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T16:16:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/msci-biochemistry-biological-chemistry.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Biochemistry and Genetics BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry-genetics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Chris Walters</name>     </author>     <summary>This course provides you with a thorough, modern training in both biochemistry and genetics, emphasising common areas such as molecular biology, genetic engineering and biotechnology.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:03:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T16:09:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry-genetics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Biochemistry and Genetics MSci</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/msci-biochemistry-genetics.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Chris Walters</name>     </author>     <summary>This course provides you with a thorough, modern training in both biochemistry and genetics, emphasising common areas such as molecular biology, genetic engineering and biotechnology.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:01:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T16:20:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/msci-biochemistry-genetics.aspx</id>   </entry>   <entry>     <title>Biochemistry and Molecular Medicine BSc</title>     <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry-molecular-medicine.aspx" />     <author>       <name>Chris Walters</name>     </author>     <summary>Modern biochemistry covers a wide area including molecular cell biology, molecular genetics, biotechnology, metabolism, and nutrition, and underpins all current advances in the biomedical sciences.</summary>     <published>2011-07-13T18:03:00Z</published>     <updated>2015-03-09T16:14:00Z</updated>     <id>http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/biochemistry/bsc-biochemistry-molecular-medicine.aspx</id>   </entry> </feed>
